element.short: The condition, disease, phenotypic feature, etc that this participant may have.
element.definition: The condition, disease, phenotypic feature, etc that this participant may have.

element.short: Detailed description / free text about this condition.
element.definition: Detailed description / free text about this condition.

element.short: The date or age at which this condition is being asserted.
element.definition: The date or age at which this condition is being asserted.

element.short: Does the participant have this condition?
element.definition: Does the participant have this condition?

element.short: Does this condition represent a specific "type" of condition, such as "Phenotypic Feature" vs "Disease" in a rare disease setting.
element.definition: Does this condition represent a specific "type" of condition, such as "Phenotypic Feature" vs "Disease" in a rare disease setting.

element.short: The age of onset for this condition. Could be expressed with a term, an age, or an age range.
element.definition: The age of onset for this condition. Could be expressed with a term, an age, or an age range.

element.short: The age at which this condition was resolved, abated, or cured. Should be left empty in cases of current active status. Could be expressed with a term, an age, or an age range.
element.definition: The age at which this condition was resolved, abated, or cured. Should be left empty in cases of current active status. Could be expressed with a term, an age, or an age range.

element.short: Any additional modifiers for this condition, such as severity.
element.definition: Any additional modifiers for this condition, such as severity.

element.short: Location information, such as site and/or laterality, of the condition. Multiple values should be interpreted cumulatively, so complex location information, such as "right lung" and "left kidney" may require multiple condition rows.
element.definition: Location information, such as site and/or laterality, of the condition. Multiple values should be interpreted cumulatively, so complex location information, such as "right lung" and "left kidney" may require multiple condition rows.

element.short: Where or how was this this assertion about the Participant recorded? This can support understanding the differences between surveys, automated EHR extraction, manual chart abstraction, etc.
element.definition: Where or how was this this assertion about the Participant recorded? This can support understanding the differences between surveys, automated EHR extraction, manual chart abstraction, etc.

element.short: Who recorded this assertion about the Participant? This can support understanding the differences between self-report, doctor, trained research staff.
element.definition: Who recorded this assertion about the Participant? This can support understanding the differences between self-report, doctor, trained research staff.
